body:
If you're experiencing issues with hearing anything in the Studycat app, try the following troubleshooting steps:

  1. Check Your Volume:

    • Ensure that your device’s volume is turned up. Use the volume buttons on your phone or tablet to increase the sound level.

  2. Turn Off Silent Mode:

    • Make sure your device is not on silent mode. Switch off the silent mode using the toggle button on the side of your phone or via the settings menu.

  3. Enable Background Music:

    • Open the Studycat app and go to the settings menu.
    • Ensure that the background music is turned on.

  4. Check Other Apps:

    • Verify if the sound issue is specific to the Studycat app by playing audio in other apps (e.g., YouTube, music player).
    • If other apps also have no sound, the issue might be with your device rather than the Studycat app.

  5. Restart Your Device:

    • Sometimes, a simple restart can fix sound issues. Turn off your device completely and then turn it back on.

If you’ve tried all these steps and still can’t hear anything, please contact our support team for further assistance.
title: Sound Issues

body:
How to switch and create profiles for up to 4 learners
Here's how you can switch between profiles and add new ones:

Creating new profiles

  • Tap the cat icon in the top left corner of the screen
  • Tap the "Switch" icon: Look for the square with two blue cat heads
  • Select "+"
  • Pick a cat, enter name and age

Switching profiles

  • Tap the cat icon
  • Tap the "Switch" icon
  • Pick the profile (cat) you want to switch to from the list

Managing profiles

  • Editing: To edit a profile, go to "Profiles" icon, select the profile, and choose "Edit."
  • Deleting: you can not delete profiles currently.
title: Studycat English now with multiple learner profiles!

body:
Learn English - Studycat

 
1. Select the portal icon
 
 
2. Navigate to your profile
 
 
 
3. Select the settings icon
 
 
4. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order, for example '551'
 
 
5. Scroll down
 
 
6. Toggle the Game lives or Game clocks on or off
 
 
 

Other Studycat games 

 

Games in medium or hard difficulty often have limited lives or limited time. If you would like to turn off these limits in the games you can do so like this:

  1. Tap Parents Area
  2. Tap Settings
  3. Toggle Lives or Timer on or off
title: Game Timer & Lives

body:
1. Create a Studycat account: Create your account now

On a device using the Apple ID used to make the purchase

2. Install the latest version of the app.

3. Navigate to the parent's area from the main menu

4. Select 'My subscription'

5. Select 'Restore purchases'

6. Select 'Sign in' and then sign in using your Studycat account login credentials.

 

On the other device

7. Install the latest version of the app.

8. From the parent's area, select 'My subscription' and then 'Sign in' using your Studycat account login credentials.

 

IMPORTANT: When signing in to your Studycat account, please ensure that you select the same method that you used when creating your account. For example, if you created your account using 'Sign in with Google', please use the same method within the app.

 

Once you have successfully logged in, your subscription content will be available to you.
title: Using your app on multiple devices (Apple)

body:
If you purchased your free trial or subscription from within your Studycat app on an iOS device, your account is managed through your Apple ID.

Apple do not share your personal or purchase details with Studycat. Furthermore, Apple will only accept account instructions from the account holder, which means that we are unable to request this on your behalf. Please see the instructions below about how to cancel your subscription.

How to cancel a subscription on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch

1. Open the Settings app on your device.

2. Tap your name and then tap Subscriptions.

​​

3. Tap the subscription that you want to manage.

​​

4. Tap Cancel Subscription.

- Select ‘Cancel Free Trial’ if you are within your trial period.

- Select ‘Cancel Subscription’ if you are already a paying subscriber.

You can also switch between subscription types from this screen. To do so, simply tap your preferred subscription type.

​​

If you don’t see ‘Cancel Free Trial’ or ‘Cancel Subscription’, the subscription is already canceled and won't renew.
title: Cancelling your subscription from the Apple App Store

body:
No problem!

Simply submit a request to be connected with the right person to assist you.

Please include a detailed description as well as any screenshots that will help understand what you need assistance with.

 

Contact us
title: My question isn't answered here, how can I get in contact with support?

body:
The process of accessing your free trial or subscription is dependent on where you made your initial purchase.

  • If you purchased from within your Studycat app, please follow the 'purchases from the Apple App Store or Google Play' instructions immediately below.
  • For purchases from studycat.com, please scroll down to view down.  

Purchases from the Apple App Store or Google Play

If you purchased from within your Studycat app, you can access your subscription content by restoring your purchases from the 'parents' area of the app. To do so, please follow the instructions below.

 

For Learn Spanish:

1. Open your Studycat app and select the settings button to access the parents area

2. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order

 

 

3. Select 'Manage my subscription'

​​

 

 

4. You will be redirected to the App Store or Google Play Store where you will be able to access your subscription.

5. Your subscription content will be available to you when you return to the main menu.

 

For Learn English:

1. Select any profile

2. Select the cat profile at the top of the screen

3. Go to settings

4. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order

6. Select 'Manage my subscription'

7. You will be redirected to the App Store or Google Play Store where you will be able to access your subscription.

8. Your subscription content will be available to you when you return to the main menu.

 

For all other apps

1. Open your Studycat app and select the parents section

2. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order

3. Select "My subscription"

4. Select "Manage"

5. You will be redirected to the App Store or Google Play Store where you will be able to access your subscription.

6. Your subscription content will be available to you when you return to the main menu.

 

IMPORTANT

Your device must be using the same Apple or Google ID used to make your subscription purchase. 

  • Family Sharing: Subscriptions purchased from the Apple App Store can be shared with family members by using Apple Family Sharing
  • Register with Studycat to access on Android and iOS devices: If you would like to use your App Store or Google Play subscription on devices that are not using your Apple or Google ID, you can register with Studycat and then sign in to the app to synchronise your subscriptions with our servers. After you have done this on a device that uses your Apple or Google ID, please sign in using your Studycat account to access your subscription content on Android and iOS devices. 

Purchases from studycat.com

If you purchased or redeemed a purchase from studycat.com, you'll need to sign in to the app with your Studycat account to access your free trial or subscription.
title: I'm unable to access my subscription content on my device

body:
Your refund request

All payments are processed by Google Play. If your payment was processed within the last 48 hours, please request a refund from Google Play here:

https://support.google.com/googleplay/contact/play_request_refund_apps

 

If your payment was processed more than 48 hours ago, please forward the following details HERE so we can arrange your refund.

  1. Your Google ID: the email address attached to the account.
  2. Reason for Refund: A brief explanation of why you require a refund.

Once we have received the above, we will arrange your refund for you and the item will show on your account within 3-5 days.
title: Refund (Google Play purchase)

body:
Your refund request

If you purchased your free trial or subscription from within your Studycat app on an iOS device, your account is managed through your Apple ID.

Apple do not share your personal or purchase details with Studycat. Furthermore, Apple will only accept account instructions from the account holder, which means that we are unable to request this on your behalf. Please see the instructions below about how to cancel your subscription.

 

How to request a refund from Apple

1. Sign in to reportaproblem.apple.com

2. Tap or click "I'd like to," then choose "Request a refund."

3. Choose the reason why you want a refund, then choose Next.

4. Choose the app, subscription, or other item, then choose Submit.

If you were charged for a subscription that you no longer want, you can also cancel the subscription

 

​​

 

If you can't request a refund on reportaproblem.apple.com

- If the charge is pending, you canʼt request a refund yet. After the charge goes through, try to request a refund again.

- If you have an unpaid order, you need to pay for that order before you request a refund. You might need to update your payment information.

- If you don't know why you were charged, review your family members' purchases. If you're the family organiser, tap or click the Apple ID button, then choose All. Purchases charged to your shared payment method appear.

 

If you already requested a refund

Check the status of your refund request.

Full details are available here:https://support.apple.com/HT204088
title: Refund (Apple App Store purchase)

body:
The process of accessing your free trial or subscription is dependent on where you made your initial purchase.

  • If you purchased from within your Studycat app, please follow the 'purchases from the Apple App Store or Google Play' instructions immediately below.
  • For purchases from studycat.com, please scroll down to view down.  

Purchases from the Apple App Store or Google Play

If you purchased from within your Studycat app, you can access your subscription content by restoring your purchases from the 'parents' area of the app. To do so, please follow the instructions below.

1. Open your Studycat app and navigate to the 'Parents' area from the main menu.

2. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order, for example '924'

 

 

3. Select 'My subscription' 

​​

 

 

4. Select 'Restore purchases' to the app will check with your App Store or Google Play ID for your purchases.

​​

 

5. Your subscription content will be available to you when you return to the main menu.

 

 

IMPORTANT

  • Your device must be using the same Apple or Google ID used to make your subscription purchase. 
  • Family Sharing: Subscriptions purchased from the Apple App Store can be shared with family members by using Apple Family Sharing
  • Register with Studycat to access on Android and iOS devices: If you would like to use your App Store or Google Play subscription on devices that are not using your Apple or Google ID, you can register with Studycat and then sign in to the app to synchronise your subscriptions with our servers. After you have done this on a device that uses your Apple or Google ID, please sign in using your Studycat account to access your subscription content on Android and iOS devices. 

Purchases from studycat.com

If you purchased or redeemed a purchase from studycat.com, you'll need to sign in to the app with your Studycat account to access your free trial or subscription.

 

How to sign in with your Studycat account

Sign in from the welcome screen

The welcome screen is displayed when you open your Studycat app for the first time.  

1. Select 'Already have an account?' from the welcome screen

2. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order, for example '924'

3. Select the sign in method that you used when creating your Studycat account

IMPORTANT: Please ensure that you select the same sign in method that you used when creating your Studycat account. 

 

Sign in from the parent's area

1. Navigate to the 'Parents' area from the main menu.

 

2. Pass through the age verification screen by typing the numbers on the screen in order, for example '924'

 

3. Select 'My subscription'

4. Select 'Sign In'

 

5. Select the sign in method that you used when creating your Studycat account

 

IMPORTANT: Please ensure that you select the same sign in method that you used when creating your Studycat account. 

 

6. After signing in, your free trial or subscription content will be available to you when you return to the main menu.
title: Access your free trial or subscription

body:
This depends on where you started the free trial.

Please see the relevant instructions below.

Apple App Store

Your subscriptions and payments are processed through your Apple ID account.

To view, change or cancel your subscriptions, please sign in to your Apple ID account. Instructions are available here:https://support.apple.com/HT202039

Google Play

Your subscriptions and payments are processed through your Google ID account.

To view, change or cancel your subscriptions, please sign in to your Google ID account. Instructions are available here:https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/7018481
title: Cancelling your free trial

body:
How to manage your subscription

Subscription management is dependent on where you made your initial purchase.

If you purchased from within your Studycat app, your subscription is managed through your App Store or Google Play account.

 

Please see the relevant instructions below.

 

Apple App Store

Your subscriptions and payments are processed through your Apple ID account. Furthermore, Apple do not share any of your personal or purchase data with Studycat and will only accept account enquiries and instructions from the account holder.

To view, change or cancel your subscriptions, please sign in to your Apple ID account. Instructions are available here:https://support.apple.com/HT202039

 

Google Play

Your subscriptions and payments are processed through your Google ID account.

To view, change or cancel your subscriptions, please sign in to your Google ID account. Instructions are available here:https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/7018481

If you continue to have difficulty managing your Google Play subscription, please contact us here.

 

Studycat.com 

IMPORTANT: New purchases are no longer available from studycat.com. 

If you purchased from our website, you can manage your subscriptions your account area on studycat.com.

  • Visit your Studycat.com account: https://studycat.com/
  • Sign in using your Studycat account login credentials.
  • Go to 'My Subscriptions' to view, change or cancel your subscription.

Alternatively, contact us here
title: Manage your subscription

title: Accessing Apple Family Sharing?

body:
In the first instance, please could you try the following?

  1. Uninstall the app from your device.
  2. Download the latest version from your app store. You can restore your purchases by going to the app settings and then selecting 'restore purchases'.

If that does not solve the issue, please Submit a Request with the following information below so we can investigate further.

  1. The app name and the version number: for example, Learn English and 21.1.0 - you can find this by going to the settings area; the version number is listed in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen.
  2. The type of operating system your device is using, e.g., Apple
  3. Description: A brief description of exactly what is happening.
  4. Video or Screenshots: If you could also provide screenshots or a video of the error happening, it may help us to identify and resolve the issue quicker.
title: A game isn't working | Error

body:
If you are unable to get the app to record your voice, it's likely that you need to set-up the microphone permissions on your device.

How to set-up microphone permissions on your device for voice recording activities

To switch on access to the microphone please follow the instructions below:

  1. Go to Settings

  2. Select Privacy

  3. Then select microphone

If that doesn't solve the issue, you may need to uninstall and then reinstall the app.

On the first open of a voice recording game, it will ask for your permission to access the microphone at that point.
title: Fixing voice recording activity issues

body:
You can subscribe from within the app through your app store account.

All subscriptions are granted a 7 day free trial.

From your app store

  1. Open the app and navigate to the main menu.
  2. Tap 'subscribe' to view the subscription options.
  3. Select your subscription of choice (for example, pay monthly or yearly).
  4. Follow the instructions from your app store. No payment will be taken until the free trial expires. If you wish to cancel, please log in to your app store account to manage your subscription.
title: Purchasing a Studycat curriculum

body:
Free trial explained

All Studycat curriculums come with a 7-day free trial.

How does the free trial work?

When signing up for the 7-day free trial you will get access to all language learning activities within our apps. 

  • The first 7 days are free.
  • No payment will be applied for during the free trial period.
  • Cancel anytime within the free trial period and pay nothing!

How to view, edit or cancel your free trial

This depends on where you purchased your free trial. Please see the relevant instructions below.

If you opted to start a free trial from within the app, your free trial and subscriptions are processed through your App Store or Google Play account.

Apple App Store

Your subscriptions and payments are processed through your Apple ID account.

To view, change or cancel your subscriptions, please sign in to your Apple ID account. Instructions are available here:https://support.apple.com/HT202039

Google Play

Your subscriptions and payments are processed through your Google ID account.

To view, change or cancel your subscriptions, please sign in to your Google ID account. Instructions are available here:https://support.google.com/googleplay/answer/7018481
title: 7-day free trial
